thread.title: Kings’ Rajon Rondo: Relationship with coach George Karl not going well
thread.title_full: Kings’ Rajon Rondo: Relationship with coach George Karl not going well

author: SI Wire
title: Kings’ Rajon Rondo: Relationship with coach George Karl not going well
text:
Kings’ Rajon Rondo: Relationship with coach George Karl not going well Sports Illustrated 5 hrs ago SI Wire © Sports Illustrated kings rajon rondo george karl relationship
Sacramento Kings point guard Rajon Rondo acknowledged to Cowbell Kingdom that his relationship with head coach George Karl is off to a rocky start.
AdChoices In a postgame interview after the Kings’ 107–100 preseason win over the Los Angeles Lakers on Tuesday, Rondo said he has been enjoying getting to know his new teammates, but that his relationship with Karl hasn't been smooth.
“It’s not been going too well,” Rondo said. “We’ve gotten into some arguments in the last couple days. Hopefully we continue to talk and get better.”
After joining the Kings this off-season on a $10 million deal , Rondo said he thought he and Karl were “a great fit.”
Rondo, a four-time All Star, has a history of butting heads with his coaches. After Dallas Mavericks coach Rick Carlisle benched Rondo in a playoff loss to the Houston Rockets in April, Rondo stayed away from the team for the remainder of the series. He was also suspended for one game in February for arguing with Carlisle after being benched.
Rondo averaged 8.9 points and 7.9 assists in 68 games last season.
The Kings will play their final preseason game on Saturday against the New Orleans Pelicans before opening the regular season on Oct. 28 against the Los Angeles Clippers.
• Video: Lakers’ Kobe Bryant exits preseason game with left leg injury
- Erin Flynn
